pageContext.claim: “Last year, lawmakers in New York cheered with delight upon the passage of legislation that would allow a baby to be ripped from the mother's womb right up until delivery.”
pageContext.analysis: The legislation in New York would not have allowed "babies to be ripped from the womb of their mother right up to the very moment of death" (or birth, as Trump may have meant to say). It states that a health-care practitioner “may perform an abortion when, according to the practitioner’s reasonable and good faith professional judgment based on the facts of the patient’s case: the patient is within twenty-four weeks from the commencement of pregnancy, or there is an absence of fetal viability, or the abortion is necessary to protect the patient’s life or health."
